intro: Gentiana tetrasepala, commonly known as the four-lobed gentian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas. The genus Gentiana is known for its showy flowers and medicinal properties, with G. tetrasepala being no exception.
